en: Man is not the creature, so much as he is the creator, of circumstances.
ko: 사람은 환경의 지배를 받기보다 오히려 환경을 직접 만드는 존재예요.

en: Man is a creature of emotion.
All human beings have the same kind of body.
ko: 모든 인간은 똑같은 신체 구조를 가지고 있어요.

en: Man is the only animal that uses fire.
Humans can't live on Mars.
Man is the only animal that can make use of fire.
ko: 인간은 불을 다룰 줄 아는 유일한 동물이에요.

en: Man differs from animals in that he can use fire.
ko: 사람은 불을 쓸 수 있다는 점에서 동물과 달라요.

en: Man is the only animal that can use fire.
ko: 불을 쓸 줄 아는 동물은 인간밖에 없어요.

en: People build houses, dams, bridges, ships and so on.
ko: 사람들은 집, 댐, 다리, 배 같은 것들을 만들어요.

en: Man is but a reed, the weakest in nature, but he is a thinking reed.
ko: 인간은 자연에서 가장 연약한 갈대일 뿐이지만, 생각하는 갈대이기도 해요.

en: All human beings are much more intelligent than animals.
ko: 모든 인간은 동물보다 훨씬 더 똑똑해요.

en: It matters not how long we live, but how.
ko: 얼마나 오래 사느냐보다 어떻게 사느냐가 중요해요.

en: People love to talk - talk - talk.
ko: 사람들은 수다 떠는 걸 정말 좋아해요.

en: People can talk but animals cannot.
ko: 사람은 말을 할 수 있지만 동물은 못 해요.

en: They have climbed the highest mountains and walked on the floor of the seas.
ko: 인류는 가장 높은 산에 오르기도 하고 바다 밑바닥까지 걸어가기도 했어요.

en: One lives but once in the world.
You only live once.
Human beings are emotional creatures, so to speak.
When did man start to use tools?
When did man start using tools?
ko: 인간이 도구를 사용하기 시작한 건 언제인가요?

en: When did people start using tools?
When did people start to use tools?
ko: 사람들이 도구를 쓰기 시작한 게 언제예요?

en: Human beings are not always wiser than animals.
ko: 인간이 항상 동물보다 더 지혜로운 건 아니에요.

en: Human beings usually have two basic desires: to get away from pain and to arrive at pleasure.
ko: 인간은 보통 두 가지 기본 욕구가 있는데, 고통을 피하고 즐거움을 찾는 거예요.

en: Man will die sooner or later.
ko: 사람은 조만간 다 죽게 되어 있어요.

en: Man may well, in his attempt to be too ambitious, destroy himself.
ko: 사람은 너무 야심을 부리다가 스스로를 망칠 수도 있어요.

en: Man is 70% water.
Man has been writing for about 6000 years.
Man has two feet.
Men first visited the moon in 1969.
ko: 사람이 처음 달에 발을 들인 건 1969년이에요.

en: Man is none the happier for his wealth.
ko: 돈이 많다고 해서 꼭 더 행복한 건 아니에요.

en: Man has the gift of speech which no animal has.
ko: 사람은 동물에게 없는 말하는 능력을 타고났어요.

en: Man prides himself on the increase in his knowledge.
Men differ from brutes in that they can think and speak.
ko: 사람은 생각하고 말할 수 있다는 점에서 짐승과 달라요.

en: Man differs from animals in that he can speak and think.
ko: 말하고 생각할 수 있다는 게 인간이 동물과 다른 점이에요.

en: Human history is in essence a history of ideas.
A person's soul is immortal.
Man's soul is immortal.
Nature is beyond mortal control.
ko: 자연은 인간이 어찌할 수 있는 게 아니에요.

en: The more we have, the greater our desire will be.
The savage in man is never quite eradicated.
ko: 인간 내면의 야만성은 절대 완전히 사라지지 않아요.

en: In humans, the eyes act together with the brains.
Men's wants become greater in proportion to the increase in their income.
The human brain can adapt to new situations.
ko: 사람의 뇌는 새로운 상황에 잘 적응해요.

en: Our existence is a miracle in itself.
There is no limit to human progress.
Man's body is a sort of machine.
ko: 인간의 몸은 일종의 기계 같은 거예요.

en: Human parents teach some words by giving babies what they ask for.
ko: 부모는 아기가 원하는 걸 주면서 말을 가르쳐줘요.

en: The true value of a man lies not so much in what he has as in what he is.
ko: 사람의 진정한 가치는 가진 게 아니라 됨됨이에 있어요.

en: The true value of a man does not lie in what he has.
ko: 사람의 참된 가치는 무엇을 가졌느냐에 있지 않아요.

en: Those books which have made a lasting contribution to man's quest for truth, we call great books.
ko: 진리를 향한 인류의 탐구에 영구적으로 기여한 책들을 우리는 위대한 책이라고 불러요.

en: The human heart has hidden treasures, in secret kept, in silence sealed.
ko: 사람의 마음에는 비밀스럽고 고요하게 간직된 보물들이 있어요.

en: The soul of man is larger than the sky and deeper than the ocean.
ko: 인간의 영혼은 하늘보다 넓고 바다보다 깊어요.

en: The human soul longs for something noble.
Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
A man's worth lies not so much in what he has as in what he is.
ko: 사람의 가치는 재산보다는 어떤 사람인지에 있어요.

en: A man's worth lies in what he is rather than what he has.
ko: 사람의 가치는 가진 것보다 그 사람의 됨됨이에 달려 있어요.

en: A man's worth lies in what he is.
ko: 사람의 가치는 그 사람 자체에 있어요.

en: A man's worth lies not in what he has but in what he is.
ko: 사람의 가치는 가진 게 아니라 됨됨이에 있는 거예요.

en: A man's worth depends on what he is, and not what he has.
ko: 사람의 가치는 소유가 아니라 존재에 달려 있어요.

en: Man has the ability to talk.
Man has reason, animals do not.
Water is as precious as air to man.
Man is a more dangerous foe to man than the elements of nature or animals in the wild.
ko: 사람에게는 자연이나 야생 동물보다 사람이 더 위험한 적이에요.

en: Human nature revolts against such a crime.
ko: 인간의 본성은 그런 범죄에 거부감을 느껴요.

en: It is language that distinguishes man from beasts.
ko: 인간과 짐승을 구분해 주는 건 바로 언어예요.

en: This is where human beings and animals greatly differ.
ko: 이게 바로 사람과 동물이 크게 다른 점이에요.

en: Every person has a psychological need to feel that what he does is of some importance.
ko: 누구나 자기가 하는 일이 중요하다고 느끼고 싶어 하는 심리가 있어요.

en: Man alone has the ability to reason.
Human beings alone take a very long time to bring up their little ones.
ko: 인간만이 아이를 키우는 데 아주 오랜 시간이 걸려요.

en: Only human beings are capable of speech.
ko: 오직 인간만이 말을 할 수 있어요.

en: Just when the first human beings will reach Mars remains to be seen.
ko: 인류가 언제 처음 화성에 도착할지는 두고 봐야 해요.

en: It is no longer a dream for man to live on the moon.
ko: 사람이 달에 사는 건 이제 더 이상 꿈이 아니에요.

en: It matters not how a man dies, but how he lives.
The time may come when people will have used up all the oil.
ko: 사람들이 석유를 다 써버리는 날이 올지도 몰라요.

en: It's possible, though rare, for humans to catch diseases from animals.
ko: 드물긴 하지만 사람이 동물한테 병이 옮을 수도 있어요.

en: Men, dogs, fish, and birds are all animals.
ko: 사람, 개, 물고기, 새는 모두 동물이에요.

en: What one is is more important than what one has.
ko: 어떤 사람인지가 무엇을 가졌는지보다 더 중요해요.

en: You have to blast your way out.
Visiting people is nicer than being visited.
ko: 남의 집을 방문하는 게 손님을 맞는 것보다 더 편해요.

en: Don't judge a man by his clothes.
Don't make a fool of me.
The secret of influencing people lies not so much in being a good talker as in being a good listener.
ko: 사람들의 마음을 얻는 비결은 말을 잘하는 것보다 잘 들어주는 데 있어.

en: In order to know a man, you have only to travel with him for a week.
ko: 어떤 사람을 알려면 딱 일주일만 같이 여행해 보면 돼.

en: You should not keep people waiting.
It is wrong of you to discriminate against people because of their race.
ko: 인종 때문에 사람을 차별하는 건 잘못된 거야.

en: It is rude to laugh at others.
He who helps others, in turn shall be helped by them.
ko: 남을 돕는 사람은 결국 그 사람들에게 도움을 받게 돼.

en: It is not right to put a man to death for punishment.
ko: 처벌로 사람을 사형에 처하는 건 옳지 않아.

en: Don't point at others.
It is bad manners to point at people.
ko: 사람을 손가락으로 가리키는 건 예의가 아니야.

en: It is rude to point at people.
It's rude to point at anyone.
We sometimes judge others based on their actions.
ko: 우리는 가끔 행동으로 사람을 판단하곤 해.

en: Could you page someone for me?
You shouldn't judge a man by his appearance.
You shouldn't judge a person by his appearance.
ko: 겉모습만 보고 사람을 판단해서는 안 돼.

en: Never trust a stranger.
Don't judge people by their appearance.
Don't judge people by appearance.
Distrust of people, not to mention hate, is the root of human suffering.
ko: 미움은 말할 것도 없고, 사람을 불신하는 게 모든 고통의 근원이야.

en: You shouldn't judge a person by his looks.
You should not judge a person by his appearance alone.
ko: 겉모습만 보고 사람을 판단하면 안 돼.

en: When we deal with people, it would be wise to try to separate the sheep from the goats without letting them know it.
ko: 사람을 대할 때, 상대가 모르게 좋은 사람과 나쁜 사람을 가려내는 게 현명해.

en: We'd better send for help.
Don't judge a man by what he has.
You should not judge people by their appearance.
Mary scared Tom out of his wits.
Let's refrain from stabbing people with knives.
ko: 칼로 사람 찌르는 짓은 하지 말자.

en: It's impolite to stare at people.
Don't make fun of people.
Don't kid me!
Don't make fun of other people.
It is not good to laugh at others.
The people have made their preparations for the trip.
People thought him to be a great scholar.
A time will soon come when people can enjoy space travel.
ko: 사람들이 우주 여행을 즐길 수 있는 날이 곧 올 거야.

en: People react to the frustration in much the same way.
ko: 사람들은 좌절에 대해 거의 비슷하게 반응해.

en: You can know a man by his friends.
ko: 친구를 보면 그 사람을 알 수 있어.

en: A man is known by his friends.
One shouldn't betray one's friends.
Man likes bright sunshine.
Man is the measure of all things.
People usually go after fame.
You will be known by the company you keep.
ko: 네가 어울리는 사람들을 보면 너를 알 수 있어.

en: People can turn to the law if they want to correct an injustice.
ko: 부당함을 바로잡고 싶으면 법에 호소할 수 있어.

en: Man modifies to his needs what nature produces.
ko: 인간은 자연이 생산하는 것을 필요에 맞게 고쳐 써.

en: A man is not always what he seems.
One is more prone to make mistakes when one is tired.
ko: 피곤하면 실수를 더 많이 하기 마련이야.

en: The older we grow, the more forgetful we become.
As one grows older, one becomes more silent.
The older one grows, the weaker one's memory becomes.
A man will succeed to the same extent as he perseveres.
One can't do lots of things at the same time.
ko: 한 번에 여러 가지 일을 할 수는 없어.

en: One cannot do lots of things at the same time.
ko: 한꺼번에 많은 일을 할 수는 없지.

en: People can't do a lot of things at the same time.
ko: 사람들은 동시에 많은 일을 못 해.

en: A man must work.
One should be considerate about things and considerate of people.
ko: 사물에 대해서도 사람에 대해서도 배려할 줄 알아야 해.

en: A man can receive only what is given to him from heaven.
ko: 사람은 하늘이 정해준 것만 받을 수 있어.

en: The more a man knows, the more he discovers his ignorance.
ko: 사람은 알면 알수록 자기가 무지하다는 걸 알게 돼.

en: A person is either male or female.
All are equal.
Everyone should periodically receive a physical examination.
Every sane man is accountable to his conscience for his behavior.
ko: 제정신인 사람이라면 자기 행동에 대해 양심에 책임을 져야 해.

en: Not everybody can be an artist.
ko: 누구나 다 예술가가 될 수는 없어.

en: Not everybody wants to be an artist.
ko: 모두가 예술가가 되고 싶어 하는 건 아니야.

en: All men have some natural talent, but the question is whether they can use it or not.
ko: 사람에겐 다 재능이 있지만, 그걸 쓸 수 있느냐 없느냐가 문제야.

en: Every man has his own strong points.
One should wash oneself.
People should wash themselves.
People should wash their bodies.
It is generally accepted that a person cannot be successful in life without a lot of hard work.
ko: 엄청난 노력 없이는 성공할 수 없다는 게 일반적인 생각이야.

en: A man is more or less what he looks like.
People once held that the world was flat.
As soon as man is born he begins to die.
Are people born intelligent or stupid, or is intelligence the result of how you live?
ko: 사람은 똑똑하거나 멍청하게 태어나는 걸까, 아니면 지능은 어떻게 사느냐에 따른 결과일까?

en: Is it valid to say that all men are created equal?
ko: 모든 사람이 평등하게 태어났다는 말이 맞는 걸까?

en: From the moment of his birth, man cannot get along without depending on others.
ko: 사람은 태어나는 순간부터 남한테 의지하지 않고는 못 살아.

en: Man eats to live, he does not live to eat.
ko: 살기 위해 먹는 거지, 먹으려고 사는 게 아니야.

en: A man must be honest.
One must always keep one's promise.
It's necessary for us to sleep well.
One must love one's neighbor.
One should keep one's promise.
We must be careful of our health.
A man is responsible for his deeds.
ko: 사람은 자기 행동에 책임을 져야 해.

en: One learns from one's own mistakes.
ko: 사람은 자기 실수를 통해서 배우는 거야.

en: One should do one's duties.
One must do one's duty.
One ought to be true to oneself.
One is apt to think oneself faultless. State the facts as they are.
ko: 사람은 스스로 결점이 없다고 생각하기 쉬워. 있는 그대로 사실을 말해 봐.

en: You don't know when you're alive.
ko: 살아있을 땐 그 소중함을 잘 몰라.

en: People are sometimes tempted to eat more than they should.
ko: 사람은 가끔 필요 이상으로 먹고 싶을 때가 있어.

en: The more people have, the more they want.
ko: 사람은 가질수록 더 갖고 싶어 해.

en: The more we have, the more we want.
Man lives in communities such as cities and countries.
ko: 사람은 도시나 국가 같은 공동체 속에서 살아.

en: One should do one's best.
Man fears disasters such as floods and fires.
ko: 사람은 홍수나 화재 같은 재난을 무서워해.

en: It may be said that a man is known by the company he keeps.
ko: 사귀는 친구를 보면 그 사람을 알 수 있다고들 하지.

en: People love to inspect each other's houses.
ko: 사람들은 서로 남의 집 구경하는 거 좋아해.

en: People love to check out each other's houses.
ko: 사람들은 서로 남의 집 살펴보는 거 좋아해.

en: We express our thoughts by means of words.
Men are not always what they seem to be.
A man cannot be judged by his appearance.
ko: 사람을 겉모습만 보고 판단해서는 안 돼요.

en: One should take care of oneself.
You should take care of yourself.
People learn from experience.
Men can not exist without air.
ko: 공기 없이는 사람도 살 수 없어요.

en: Accordingly as people become rich, they are apt to be stingy.
A person views things differently according to whether they are rich or poor.
ko: 부유하냐 가난하냐에 따라 세상을 보는 게 달라져요.

en: People look at things differently depending on whether they are rich or poor.
ko: 사람들은 형편에 따라 사물을 다르게 봐요.

en: One tends to shout when excited.
People tend to raise their voices when they get excited.
ko: 사람들은 신나면 목소리를 높이는 경향이 있어요.

en: People have the tendency to speak more loudly when they get excited.
ko: 사람은 흥분하면 말이 더 커지게 돼요.

en: We learn by teaching.
One should do one's duty.
We are born crying, spend our lives complaining, and die disappointed.
ko: 우리는 울면서 태어나, 불평하며 살다가, 실망하며 죽는 것 같아요.

en: One must observe the rules.
People have to obey the rules.
All men must die.
Everyone ought to be a master of his own destiny.
ko: 누구나 자기 운명의 주인이 되어야 해요.

en: People should be the masters of their own destinies.
ko: 사람들은 자기 인생을 스스로 개척해야 해요.

en: Everyone ought to be the master of his own destiny.
Every man cannot be happy.
ko: 모든 사람이 다 행복할 수는 없어요.

en: Everybody wants to be happy.
I don't suppose you ever really get over the death of a child.
ko: 자식을 잃은 슬픔은 아마 평생 극복하기 힘들 거예요.

en: One should not lament over past mistakes too long.
ko: 지난 실수에 너무 오래 연연하지 마세요.

en: One must do one's best in everything.
Man is above all things the talking animal.
People are given a lot of pleasure by music.
People can't live forever.
Man cannot live forever.
ko: 인간이 평생 살 수는 없는 노릇이죠.

en: One can't quarrel with destiny.
People as a whole don't do things like that.
ko: 보통 사람들은 그런 짓 안 해요.

en: Man is a conscious being.
People often take me for my brother.
ko: 사람들이 자주 저를 저희 형으로 착각해요.

en: Men will not look at things as they really are, but as they wish them to be.
ko: 사람들은 세상을 있는 그대로 보지 않고, 보고 싶은 대로 보려고 해요.

en: The more one has, the more one wants.
ko: 가질수록 더 갖고 싶은 게 사람 마음이에요.

en: Everyone has a right to live.
All men are fallible.
Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
ko: 누구나 달처럼 남에게 보여주지 않는 어두운 면이 있어요.

en: Different people have different ideas.
One can't learn to do anything without making mistakes.
ko: 실수 없이 무언가를 배울 수는 없어요.

en: One is judged by one's speech first of all.
ko: 사람은 우선 말하는 걸 보면 알 수 있어요.

ko: 그렇게 효심 깊은 아들이 있어서 좋으시겠어요. 노후 걱정은 안 하셔도 되겠네요.

en: By the time you wish to be a good son, your parents are long gone.
ko: 효도하고 싶을 땐 이미 부모님이 돌아가시고 안 계시더라.

en: Parents have responsibilities to look to their children's health.
